intro: Nettlera guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, often stinging leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important part of the local flora and ecosystem.
